description: Tickets use their own channel where a message exists that allows users to create and close tickets.

When a user creates a ticket, they are shown a list of customisable ticket types, where they select the one relevant to their issue. Upon selecting the ticket type, one of two things could happen depending on the ticket types mode.

tabs.name: Enabling Tickets
content: To enable tickets in your server, run the e!settickets <channel> <role>/serverconfig tickets set channel:<channel> role:<role>. For example: e!settickets #tickets @support/serverconfig tickets set channel:#tickets role:@Support

The channel is the channel you would like tickets to be created in.
The role is the role that you will give to users that you want to handle the tickets. Users with this role will be added to tickets when one is created, and one of them will be randomly assigned to handle the ticket.

data.title: Tickets set
data.description: Tickets have been set to <#tickets> with the role <@&Support>

content: After running the command, tickets will now be enabled in the selected channel!
In the tickets channel, a ticket creation message is sent, and the channel permissions get changed. Regular users are no longer allowed to send messages or create threads there.

author: Tickets

content: Even though tickets have been enabled, they will not function until you add at least one ticket type.

description: Ticket types are the different options that a user gets to select when creating a ticket. These control whether the ticket can be created, and what information needs to be filled out from them before the ticket is created.
Ticket types have different modes that change their behaviour when a user tries to create a ticket using that ticket type.

rows: If the ticket type is set to "Create" mode, they will be presented with a customisable form that they then fill out with information related to the ticket type. Upon filling out the form, the ticket will be created.

If the ticket type is set to "Deny" mode, they will be shown a customisable message that explains why the ticket could not be created, useful for stopping people from creating tickets about certain topics.

tabs.name: Adding Ticket Types
content: To add a new ticket type, first run the e!addtickettype/serverconfig tickets addtype command, and then click the button to start.
